meanings.definition: Unable to be satisfied or appeased
meanings.sent1: The insatiate hunger of the wolf drove it to hunt all night.
meanings.sent2: Her insatiate curiosity led her to read every book in the library.
meanings.sent3: The insatiate puppy kept begging for treats, never getting full.
meanings.sent4: His insatiate thirst for knowledge consumed him like a wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The insatiate longing for adventure filled her dreams with far-off lands.

meanings.sent1: The insatiate child grabbed all the toys, never wanting to share.
meanings.sent2: His insatiate greed for power blinded him to the needs of others.
meanings.sent3: The insatiate squirrel hoarded nuts in its tree, never satisfied.
meanings.sent4: Her insatiate craving for sweets led her to eat the whole cake.
meanings.sent5: The insatiate ambition of the young entrepreneur knew no bounds.

meanings.sent1: The insatiate artist was always searching for the perfect masterpiece.
meanings.sent2: Their insatiate need for approval drove them to seek constant praise.
meanings.sent3: The insatiate traveler could never stay in one place for long.
meanings.sent4: His insatiate desire for success pushed him to work tirelessly.
meanings.sent5: The insatiate quest for perfection left her feeling perpetually unsatisfied.
